Comedy drama, starring Geena Davis, Lori Petty, Tom Hanks and Madonna.(n)

programme.title: Valentine's Day
programme.desc: Anthology of stories charting the romantic complications of various Los Angeles residents. A businessman and a soldier on leave share a flight home, a teacher is smitten with a doctor and an elderly couple comfort their lovesick grandson. Romantic comedy drama, with Ashton Kutcher, Jessica Alba, Jamie Foxx, Jennifer Garner and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Black Dog
programme.desc: As part of a patrol tasked with clearing stray dogs before the 2008 Olympics, former stunt motorcyclist Lang bonds with a hound. Drama, starring Eddie Peng and Tong Liya. In Chinese with English subtitles.(n)

programme.title: Skincare
programme.desc: Small business owner Hope Goldman performs facials to celebrity clientele and powerful businesswomen. She is poised to launch her own skincare line, but is in arrears with rent on her store at a shopping complex. A rival called Angel opens in close proximity and soon after, her email is hacked and tyres slashed. Hope is convinced that Angel is the culprit and enlists hired thug Armen and young beau Jordan to extinguish the competition. Director Austin Peters' thriller, starring Elizabeth Banks and Lewis Pullman.(n)

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Two female jailbirds imprisoned for murder pull out all the stops to seize the attention of the media. Aided by a slick lawyer, both women are desperate to find fame and fortune and escape the death penalty by winning public sympathy. Musical, starring Renee Zellweger, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Richard Gere, John C Reilly and Queen Latifah.

Remake of 1934 romantic fantasy Death Takes a Holiday, starring Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Claire Forlani.

programme.title: Boy Meets Boy
programme.desc: When two young men cross paths in Berlin, a simple afternoon in the big city soon takes on a much greater meaning. Drama, starring Matthew Morrison and Alexandros Koutsoulis.

programme.title: El Dorado
programme.desc: An ageing gunfighter is drawn into the conflict between a land-grabbing cattle baron and a ranching family, but gets wounded in the process. A year later, he returns to town to find the situation has not improved - so along with his sidekick and the drunken town sheriff, he fights to defend the family from its enemies. Western, starring John Wayne, Robert Mitchum, James Caan and Ed Asner.

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Ten interlinked stories of people searching for and finding love. While the newly elected, bachelor British prime minister is smitten by a junior staff member at 10 Downing Street, a heartbroken writer heads for France to get over a failed relationship, and a faded rock star aims to reinvent himself in time for Christmas. Richard Curtis's romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon, Emma Thompson, Alan Rickman, Colin Firth, Bill Nighy and Liam Neeson.

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: One-eyed, over-the-hill US Marshal Rooster Cogburn reluctantly agrees to help a girl track down her father's killer. The quest is complicated by a Texas Ranger, who is also on the murderer's trail, and a host of villains who have few qualms about disposing of the meddling youngster and her protector. Western, starring an Oscar-winning John Wayne alongside Jeff Corey, Kim Darby, Glen Campbell, Robert Duvall and Dennis Hopper.

programme.title: There Will Be Blood
programme.desc: An oil prospector presents the public image of a caring family man while nurturing a murderous ambition to seize control of land and wealth at any cost. Romantic comedy drama, with Ashton Kutcher, Jessica Alba, Jamie Foxx, Jennifer Garner and Julia Roberts.

programme.title: PS I Love You
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow.

programme.title: Chicago

Drama, starring John Travolta, Karen Lynn Gorney and Paul Pape, and featuring songs by the Bee Gees.

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Barton Academy boarding school teacher Paul Hunham incurs the wrath of headmaster Dr Hardy Woodrup by failing the son of a powerful senator. As punishment, Woodrup selects Paul to remain on campus over Christmas to chaperone the boys who won't be travelling home for the holidays. Alexander Payne's comedy drama, starring Paul Giamatti, Da'Vine Joy Randolph and Dominic Sessa.

programme.title: The Danish Girl

Period drama based on David Ebershoff's novel inspired by the true story of artist Lili Elbe, starring Eddie Redmayne and an Oscar-winning Alicia Vikander.

programme.title: Drift
programme.desc: A young woman escapes her war-torn country to a Greek island, growing close with a tour guide as the pair find hope in each other. Director Anthony Chen's drama, starring Cynthia Erivo and Alia Shawkat.

programme.title: Oh! What a Lovely War
programme.desc: First World War musical, comprising a series of satirical sketches highlighting the futility of conflict from the perspective of the ordinary soldiers - many from the same family - and covering famous historical moments, including the Christmas truce. Richard Attenborough's directorial debut, starring Ralph Richardson, Laurence Olivier, John Mills and John Gielgud.

programme.title: Flashdance
programme.desc: A determined factory welder leads a double life as an exotic dancer by night. Her real ambition is to become a ballet star, and with the support of her boss and an instructor, she sets out to realise her dreams. Drama, with Jennifer Beals, Michael Nouri, Lilia Skala, Sunny Johnson, Kyle T Heffner and Lee Ving.

programme.title: She Came To Me
programme.desc: A composer who suffers writer's block rediscovers his passion after an adventurous one-night stand. Writer/director Rebecca Miller's comedy drama, starring Peter Dinklage and Anne Hathaway.

programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: Two single women living on opposite sides of the Atlantic agree to exchange houses over the Christmas holidays. In their new surroundings, both women unexpectedly encounter prospective partners, but as the house swap draws to a close, difficult decisions have to be made about their blossoming relationships. Romantic comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jack Black, Jude Law and Eli Wallach.

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: Death takes over the body of a recently deceased young man, and embarks on a mission to claim the life of a powerful media tycoon, but ends up falling in love with his daughter instead - leaving him on the horns of a dilemma. Remake of 1934 romantic fantasy Death Takes a Holiday, starring Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Claire Forlani.

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily Bloom returns to her childhood home of Plethora, Maine, to attend the funeral of her father, the former town mayor who beat his wife behind closed doors. Upon returning to Boston, Lily is attracted to Ryle Kincaid, a neurosurgeon with a dark side, and old flame Atlas Corrigan. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively, Justin Baldoni, Jenny Slate and Brandon Sklenar.

programme.desc: A teenager from Boston moves to a small conservative town, and discovers the council and a preacher have enforced a ban on loud music and dancing. He openly defies the harsh rules, revitalising the local youth and winning the heart of the reverend's daughter. Remake of the 1984 drama, with Kenny Wormald, Julianne Hough and Dennis Quaid.

programme.title: My First Summer
programme.desc: Isolated on a remote property after her mother's death, 16-year-old Claudia finds her world transformed when spirited teenager Grace appears. Drama, starring Markella Kavenagh and Maiah Stewardson.

programme.title: Miranda's Victim
programme.desc: Teenager Patricia 'Trish' Weir is committed to putting her kidnapper and rapist Ernesto Miranda in prison, while her life is wrecked by the legal system. Drama, starring Abigail Breslin, Emily VanCamp and Kyle MacLachlan.

programme.title: Sunset Boulevard
programme.desc: A faded film star from the silent-movie era is fixated with making a comeback. When she meets a struggling screenwriter on the run from debt collectors, she persuades him to write a script that will mark her spectacular return to the screen. However, he takes advantage of the deluded actress, becoming her lover in a relationship where their mutual deceit ends in tragedy. Drama, with Gloria Swanson, William Holden and Eric von Stroheim.

Drama, starring Kevin Bacon, Lori Singer, John Lithgow, Chris Penn, Dianne Wiest and Sarah Jessica Parker.(n)

programme.title: Love Actually

Richard Curtis's romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon, Emma Thompson, Alan Rickman, Colin Firth, Bill Nighy and Liam Neeson.(n)

programme.title: Beach Rats
programme.desc: Powerful drama about a troubled Brooklyn teen aimlessly drifting through summer while struggling to come to terms with his own desires. Starring Harris Dickinson.(n)

programme.title: Dreamgirls
programme.desc: A 1960s singing trio are chosen to perform backing vocals for a popular performer - an event that launches the band on a successful career of their own. However, when the most attractive of the girls is picked as the face of the group, edging out the other two, personal rivalries begin to jeopardise their friendship. Musical drama, inspired by the rise to fame of Diana Ross and the Supremes, and starring Jamie Foxx, Beyonce Knowles, Eddie Murphy and an Oscar-winning Jennifer Hudson.(n)

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: A man diagnosed with HIV and given 30 days to live discovers that many treatments for his condition are not available in the US. With the aid of a transsexual Aids patient, he sets up a scheme to smuggle the drugs into the country and distribute them to those in need. Fact-based drama, starring Oscar winners Matthew McConaughey and Jared Leto, with Jennifer Garner and Steve Zahn.(n)

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: A lonely and past-his-prime American actor travels to Japan to film a commercial. During a depressing night in the hotel bar, he meets a spirited younger woman and the pair strike up a close friendship, exploring Tokyo and helping each other face the mundanities of everyday life. Sofia Coppola's comedy drama, starring Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson and Giovanni Ribisi.(n)

programme.title: The Three Musketeers: Milady
programme.desc: D'Artagnan faces a race against time to rescue his kidnapped sweetheart, the queen's seamstress and confidante Constance. The young woman's survival may rest with Milady, compelling D'Artagnan to forge an uneasy alliance with his former enemy. Meanwhile, King Louis XIII faces the prospect of civil war, fuelled by conspirators within his royal court. Swashbuckling sequel, starring François Civil, Eva Green and Vincent Cassel.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Night Fever
programme.desc: A streetwise Brooklyn teenager struggles to cope with a dead-end job and a dysfunctional family. However, he finds an escape in the disco scene, where he falls in love with a woman dreaming of breaking free from her equally poor background to pursue a brighter future in Manhattan. Drama, starring John Travolta, Karen Lynn Gorney and Paul Pape, and featuring songs by the Bee Gees.(n)

programme.title: Fifty Shades of Grey
programme.desc: A naive young literature student's life is thrown into turmoil by an affair with a mysterious billionaire. Initially she is intrigued by his aloof and distant manner, but soon realises he is harbouring dark secrets and desires. Erotic drama based on EL James' bestseller, starring Jamie Dornan and Dakota Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Rurangi
programme.desc: After leaving a decade earlier, a transgender activist returns to the remote community of Rurangi, hoping to reconnect with his father. Drama, starring Elz Carrad and Arlo Green.(n)

programme.title: The Prosecutor
programme.desc: An ex-prosecutor investigates when a man falsely pleads guilty to drug trafficking after being framed, uncovering a corrupt lawyer's scheme and fighting to restore justice - despite obstruction from evil forces. Action thriller, starring Donnie Yen, Julian Cheung and Francis Ng. In Cantonese.(n)

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim
programme.desc: Helm Hammerhand sits on the throne of Rohan, flanked by sons Hama and Haleth and rebellious daughter Hera. Dunlending lord Freca proposes a marital union between Hera and his son Wulf, which Helm loudly rejects. In a subsequent brawl between fathers, Helm unintentionally lands a fatal blow, so Wulf vows revenge and amasses an army led by General Targg. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Gaia Wise, Brian Cox, Luke Pasqualino and Lorraine Ashbourne.(n)

programme.title: One of Them Days
programme.desc: When best friends and roommates Dreux and Alyssa discover the latter's boyfriend has blown their rent money, the duo faces a race against time to avoid eviction. Comedy, starring Keke Palmer and SZA.(n)

programme.title: Amongst the Wolves
programme.desc: An ex-soldier meets a teen fleeing a gang, an encounter which forces them to confront their pasts while navigating present realities. Director Mark O'Connor's thriller, starring Luke McQuillan, Aidan Gillen and Daniel Fee.(n)

programme.title: Nosferatu
programme.desc: In 1838 Germany, Thomas Hutter is sent to the Carpathian mountains to secure the signature of enigmatic nobleman Count Orlok on a property sale in the German city of Wisborg. Thomas leaves his bride Ellen in the care of friend Friedrich Harding and his wife Anna. The young man barely survives the exhausting trip to Europe and stumbles home to find Ellen driven to delirium by a telepathic bond to the Count. Director Robert Eggers' version of the Dracula-inspired horror, starring Bill Skarsgard, Lily-Rose Depp, Nicholas Hoult and Aaron Taylor-Johnson.(n)

programme.title: The Surfer
programme.desc: A father returns to Australia to buy his childhood home. To celebrate, he takes his teenage son to Luna Bay so they can surf together. However, he becomes locked in a battle of one-upmanship with local thugs. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage and Julian McMahon.(n)

programme.title: Die Alone
programme.desc: A young couple flee the city during a zombie outbreak, only to be involved in a car crash. When the man awakes, his girlfriend is missing, so he bands together with a rugged survivalist to find his partner - but he only has selected memories of what he has been through. Apocalypse drama, starring Carrie-Anne Moss, Douglas Smith, Frank Grillo and Kimberley-Sue Murray.(n)

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim
programme.desc: Helm Hammerhand sits on the throne of Rohan, flanked by sons Hama and Haleth and rebellious daughter Hera. programme.title: King Kong
programme.desc: Oscar-winning adventure, with Jack Black as a filmmaker whose star Naomi Watts is snatched by a giant ape. Moderate violence.

programme.title: Zombieland
programme.desc: With America in the grip of a zombie apocalypse, Woody Harrelson and Jesse Eisenberg team up to survive. With Emma Stone. Violence/strong language.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Clever Kids
programme.desc: These bright sparks are small but mighty. Join us as we explore the cleverest children in cinema, from the psychic Matilda to the Boss Baby, who is always down for business.

programme.title: The Tuxedo
programme.desc: Jackie Chan is mistaken for a secret agent when a hi-tech tux turns him into a superspy. Jennifer Love Hewitt stars in a gadget-packed action comedy.

programme.title: Indiana Jones And The Kingdom of the Crystal Skull
programme.desc: Harrison Ford faces off against Cate Blanchett in a hunt for the lost city of El Dorado. Violence/flashing images.

programme.title: Ghost Rider
programme.desc: Motorbike stuntman Nicolas Cage does a deal with the Devil and becomes a skull-faced avenger on two fiery wheels. Sci-fi. Contains violence and flashing images.

programme.title: Hellboy
programme.desc: A bright red demon is the FBI's key weapon for fighting Nazis and nasties. Ron Perlman stars. Violence/flashing images.

programme.title: King Kong
programme.desc: Oscar-winning adventure, with Jack Black as a filmmaker whose star Naomi Watts is snatched by a giant ape. Moderate violence.

programme.title: Snakes On A Plane
programme.desc: FBI agent Samuel L Jackson is escorting a murder witness, but has to play hero when his plane is overrun with hordes of venomous snakes. Brilliantly bonkers thriller.

programme.title: Snatch
programme.desc: Guy Ritchie's East End thriller with bare-knuckle boxing, wheeler-dealers and conmen in pursuit of a stolen jewel. Strong language/sex/violence.

programme.title: American Gangster
programme.desc: Drug lord Denzel Washington and cop Russell Crowe clash in 70s Harlem in a crime epic. Strong language/sex/violence/flashing images.

programme.title: The Da Vinci Code
programme.desc: Tom Hanks and Audrey Tautou race across Europe in a bid to uncover a secret. Mystery thriller based on the Dan Brown novel. Violence/sex.

programme.title: Vanilla Sky
programme.desc: Playboy Tom Cruise's new romance with dancer Penelope Cruz is ruined by crazed lover Cameron Diaz in this mindbending mystery. Contains strong language/sex/flashing images.

programme.title: Rugrats In Paris: The Movie
programme.desc: The adventurous little'uns travel to France, where Chucky hopes to find a new girlfriend for his dad. But things don't run quite as smoothly as planned. Fun animated comedy.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: An aspiring comic finds himself without a home after he catches his wife in a compromising position; Pete attempts to find solace at a New York comedy club, where he befriends cynical comedy legend Artie Lange.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Pete wallows in his new reality; Artie offers to let Pete be his opening act in exchange for a ride to Albany; Pete meets co-headliner T.J. Miller and attempts to save Artie from breaking his sobriety.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: While staying at T.J. Miller's place, Pete witnesses a comic who is unable to "turn it off"; Pete and T.J. travel upstate for his wife's yard sale; Pete unexpectedly teams up with Leif to get back a prized possession; Jess voices her true feelings.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: In an effort to get stage time, Pete spends the night handing out fliers for a comedy club; while on the streets of New York, Pete encounters disinterested locals, befriends up-and-coming comics, engages in a turf war and gets a pep talk.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: When Pete's parents decide to come to New York for his mother's birthday, Pete begs Jess to come along and keep up the charade of their marriage; Pete faces a turning point.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Artie Lange invites Pete to be a guest on his podcast; Pete meets Sarah Silverman, who takes pity on him and invites him to stay with her and her collection of stray comedians; Pete is presented with a job opportunity.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Pete's high from his new warm-up gig on Rachael Ray's show is interrupted by an unexpected visit from Leif's wife, who pulls him back into the chaos of his separation from Jess.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Artie tags along with Pete to a baptism; Artie gets insight into religion and God from a woman; Pete runs into Jess, which makes him question how much he is willing to sacrifice for a life in comedy.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Pete has a chance encounter with famed magician Penn Jillette, who shakes his faith and inspires him to try living with abandon for one night.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Pete spends the day with Leif, who encourages him to be open to the universe; carefree attitudes soon change when the two find themselves at odds and in trouble with the law.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: When Pete is abandoned by Artie, comic Bill Burr takes pity on him and offers his guest room; as they become unlikely friends, Bill encourages Pete to toughen up and embrace his masculine side.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Pete tries to be supportive when a fellow comic at The Boston gets his big break; Pete reconnects with Jess, who encourages him to find a healthy way to express himself.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Pete and Ali tour New York's alternative comedy scene, where they encounter a wide array of comics and venues over the course of one night.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Pete's decision to organize a secret benefit for an ailing comedy vet finds him scrambling to put on a good show and facing hard truths about Artie.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: On a trip to a comedy conference to book college gigs, Pete and Ali clash over the best strategy to appeal to the college crowd.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: In an attempt to show Ali that he has a backbone, Pete enters a comedy-roast battle, but has a hard time being mean; Pete examines his priorities in life after the fierce competition brings uncomfortable truths to the surface.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: As his successful college comedy tour comes to an end, Pete takes a college-age aspiring comedian, Jaboukie, under his wing; Pete's return to New York finds him having an awkward reunion and a big audition at the Comedy Cellar.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Feeling like his time away from New York has taken him out of the scene, Pete accepts an offer to perform at a Jewish show, where Elon Gold and Modi question his impulsive behavior with a woman he met earlier that day.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Pete falls headfirst into a relationship with a new girlfriend, Kat, who encourages him to be more aggressive in his career; on the night of their three-week anniversary, things amp up after a visit to a sex shop and a comedy show.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Pete travels to New Jersey with Jason to do a weekend of shows at a big corporate comedy club and is surprised to find Ali, his ex, staying with them at the comedy condo; Jason's misogynistic act and point of view cause Pete to question his path.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: During a tour stop, Pete pays a visit to his parents and introduces them to Kat, who notices the uncomfortably close relationship he has with his overbearing mom; Pete grows increasingly trapped between the two most important women in his life.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Pete and Kat attend a viewing party for Ali's late-night spot on Seth Meyers' show; tensions mount as Ali is nervous about how her set went and Kat becomes jealous of Pete's friendship with his ex.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: While enjoying the perks of being on a Christian comedy tour, Pete feels busted when he runs into NY Cellar comic Jessica Kirson in Charleston; after ghosting Kat while on the road, Pete finally sits down to talk about their relationship.

programme.title: Crashing
programme.desc: Pete jumps at the opportunity of a lifetime to open for John Mulaney at New York's Town Hall, but the gig leaves him in an awkward situation.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: An updated look at Boomer Esiason and his son Gunnar, and the family's journey in the fight against cystic fibrosis. The Boomer Esiason Foundation launched in 1993 has raised more than $175 million to support research. Jeremy Schaap's 2007 report on the story is revisited with new interviews featured with medical personnel, the Esiason family, fellow NFL alumni, and a pro lacrosse athlete with CF.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Tom Brady and Charles Woodson reflect on the controversial play from a Raiders-Patriots playoff in January 2002 that impacted football history, keying Brady's first postseason win and helping to launch a dynasty under coach Bill Belichick. Additional interviews include referee Walt Coleman, Patriots owner Robert Kraft and others from the game. Directed by Ken Rodgers and Nick Mascolo.

programme.title: 30 for 30
